comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: Interesting shot, this came out of some searching OCTOBER 5, 1913 Initial trials of the Navy's first amphibian flying boat--the OWL, or Over Water Land type--were completed at Hammondsport, N.Y., under the supervision of Naval Constructor Holden C. Richardson. The aircraft, subsequently redesignated E-1, was the A-2 hydroaeroplane in which the pontoon was replaced with a flying boat hull containing a three-wheel landing gear.

comment.author: 49487266@N07
